title: Research Grand Rounds Archives - Page 5 of 9 - Osher Center For Integrative Medicine
author: Vikram Patel; PhD; MBBS
description: Beginning January 2017, the Research Seminar series was combined with the monthly Integrative Medicine Grand Rounds. "Clinical Case" and "Research " Presentations alternate each month and maintain a patient-centric focus. All research seminars from 2014 through 2016 are archived below. Also available is a video library of these Research Seminars. If you would like to view Research Presentations from 2017 on, now incorporated into Integrative Medicine Grand Rounds, please visit the IM Grand Rounds page. Archives 2017 Research Presentation: Tuesday, December 5th, 2017 @ 8:00am "Safety of Supplements" Pieter Cohen, MD, Practicing Internist, Cambridge Health Alliance; Professor of Medicine, Harvard Medical School Research Presentation: Tuesday, October 5th, 2017 @8:00am "Our Bodies Shape Our Minds" Amy Cuddy, PhD, Associate Professor, Harvard Business School, Visiting Associate Professor, Harvard T. H. Chan of Public Health Research Presentation: Tuesday, August 1st, 2017 @ 8:00am "Placebos in the Clinical Arena" Leon Morales-Quezada, MD, MSc. PhD, Research Associate Director, Neuromodulation Laboratory, Spaulding Rehabilitation Hospital, Harvard Medical School Research Presentation: Tuesday, June 6th, 2017 @ 8:00am "Are physiological outcomes better than psychological outcomes to differentiate real and sham acupuncture? A carpal tunnel syndrome neuroimaging study." Vitaly Napadow, PhD, LAc., Director, Center for Integrative Pain NeuroImaging (CiPNI), Martinos Center for Biomedical Imaging, Massachusetts General Hospital Download Flier Research Presentation: Tuesday, April 4th, 2017 @ 8:00am "Tai Chi and musculoskeletal pain" Chenchen Wang, MD, MSc, Associate Professor of Medicine, Tufts University School of Medicine, Director of the Center for Complementary and Integrative Medicine, Division of Rheumatology, Tufts Medical Center Research Presentation: Tuesday, February 7th, 2017 @ 8:00am "Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Food Intolerance" Ather Ali, ND, MPH, MHS, Director, Yale Adult and Pediatric Integrative Medicine Clinic; Medical Director, Integrative Medicine Smilow Cancer Hospital at Yale-New Haven, Yale School of Medicine Dr. Ali discussed his recent clinical trial of elimination diets in irritable bowel syndrome. He discussed how a common clinical question led to a rigorous randomized trial and mechanistic study, and shared insights gained in the process. (N.B. This presentation was not video recorded, per speaker request.) 2016 December 1st: 'Medical Marijuana: Is the current research evidence sufficient to inform clinician decision making?' Donald B. Chan School of Public Health WATCH VIDEO Presentation Here 'Stretching, Connective Tissue, Fibrosis and Cancer.' WATCH VIDEO Presentation Here 'The Evolution of Chiropractic Research: From Mechanisms of Sublaxation to Comparative Cost-Effectiveness.' Thursday, March 3rd, 2016 Matthew Kowalski, DC, DABCO Licensed Chiropractor, The Osher Clinical Center for Integrative Medicine, Brigham and Women's Hospital; President of the New England Spine Institute. WATCH VIDEO Presentation Here 'Application of Mobile Health Technology to Facilitate Long-Term Engagement in Exercise in Persons with Parkinson Disease' Thursday, February, 4th, 2016 Terry Ellis, PhD, PT, NCS Director, Center for Neurorehabilitation, Boston University; Director, American Parkinson Disease Association National Rehabilitation Resource Center.
